turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: That's what he did to me.  He put cigarettes out on me.

turns.speaker: CUTLER
turns.text: Your father put cigarettes out on you?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Out on my back when I was a small boy.

turns.speaker: CUTLER
turns.text: Can I see your back?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: I'm abused.  Don't you think?

turns.speaker: CUTLER
turns.text: I don't think it's abuse, I think it's torture.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: ...so we kill someone famous and if we are caught, we are sent to mental hospital...

turns.speaker: CUTLER
turns.text: Officers, there's your killer, do your duty, arrest him!

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: ...my little sister and I shared a flat - I came home one night and a man was raping her.  His gun was on the chair... He came at me and I shot him.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Alright.  That's a justifiable homicide.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Yes, but he was a cop.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Now I become custody of police department?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: If you cooperate with the DA - maybe they'll help you with your situation.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I will if they don't send me back.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: They won't until this is over.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Are you married?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Divorced.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Do you live alone?  I've been in these clothes since...the killings.  Could we stop at your place? I could take a shower...before I go into custody?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I can't take you to my place.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Somewhere else?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: The men are out of quarters - practicing putting out fires.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: So...the station is empty?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Yeah.  This way.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You considered becoming a prostitute?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Yes, I considered it.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Did you ever turn tricks before?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: What about back home?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I came here.  I had no money.  I knew no one.  I couldn't get a job because you have to have a green card to get work. They approached me - I could've made a lot of money.  I considered it, but... it's not who I am.  They pay me below the table at Ludwig's.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: So you were never a prostitute?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: What are you asking me?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'm just trying to find out who you are.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I'm not a whore.  I'm not a whore.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: You don't know.  I'm sorry.  I was desperate.  That's not me.  I shot a cop.  Can you imagine what they'll do to me when I got to prison?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: They're not gonna send you right back.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to...I'm glad. Actually I'm glad it's over.  All this time.  Hiding.  Never being able to look anyone in the eyes. Always afraid that someone would find out who I was.  Never trusting anyone...

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I still can't believe Eddie's gone.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Is he your boyfriend?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Ludwig?  He's gay - are you jealous?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: If I was your boyfriend, I might be.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: If you were my boyfriend, I'd suggest you find another girlfriend that isn't going to jail ten-thousand miles away.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: A good Immigration lawyer could stall the process.  Eddie recommended one.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: No matter what happens...I'm glad I met you.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'm glad I met you.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You better get packed.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Do you have coffee?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: In the kitchen.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'll make some for us.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I'll get my clothes.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Pouring it out!

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Forget about me.  You have enough problems of your own.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: ...Do you really want me to forget about you?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I don't want to drag you down with me.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Daphne, I...

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I told your partner, I can't help.  I didn't see anything.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: C'mon, start at the beginning.  You know these people?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: Tamina was a friend of mine.  My shower was broken, she let me use theirs.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Go on.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Whether you tell us or not, we'll find out.  Better if it comes from you.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: If I tell you, will you arrest me?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Arrest you for what?  Why would we arrest you?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Are you here illegally?  Don't worry about that.  We'll talk to Immigration. They won't deport you.

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: No, no, don't talk to Immigration!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: A cop?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: I'm from a small town in Slovakia.  Like the South here.  The Police is right, a civilian is wrong.  So I fled.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Look, we can help you but right now we have to deal with what's happening here. Tell us the truth...is that the truth?

turns.speaker: DAPHNE
turns.text: You're a cop - you'll never believe me.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It was my decision, not his.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Well, I'm the Deputy Chief Fire Marshall and every now and then I'd like to be included in decisions.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Look, after Jordy briefs me, you can do the press conference.  How about that? The case is all yours.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Oh yeah...?  Alright.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm ready to be briefed.  Excuse us.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Yeah, sure.  Beep me when you're ready for the press conference.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Who did cause and origin?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Who do you think, Chief?!

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Then why didn't you talk to the reporter?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: 'Cause we got more important things to do, like finding out who did it.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Hey, Chief, what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: I came to see how the investigation was going.  I called and you're not here.  I wait up at the station and you don't even show up!!!  I beep you - you don't return my call.  Where the hell have you been?!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Ladder 20 was on the Rock for training. We stopped there... so she could get cleaned up.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: What do you mean, 'cleaned up?'

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I let her take a shower.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: A shower!?  Did you take one, too?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: No!  Nothing happened.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Oh really.  That's nice.  You took a homicide witness to take a shower after your partner was shot?  Are you out of your fucking mind??  Are you having that much trouble gettin' dates?!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Chief - mind if I take her?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Okay.  But not water sports.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: The public doesn't have any idea what we do and now you're going to define our image!  This is going to be our Rodney King!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: What was I supposed to do?  The guy tried to mug me.  I was gonna send a cop back - I just forgot.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Forgot?  You handcuffed a civilian to a tree?!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Chief - I know I screwed up - but this guy was no innocent civilian.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Well this is gonna end your career and probably mine.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: End my career?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: How are you going to fight this?  Maybe if Oleg hadn't gotten away and you'd been on the front page, as a hero, this thing would be easier to fight.  You'd have the good to weight against the bad! It's unfortunate that I have to make decisions based upon your press coverage but there's nothing I can do!  Gimme your shield.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: But Chief?  Over this??

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: There's nothing to talk about.  Get a good lawyer.  You're suspended until your trial.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Don't you guys understand?  It's all about image.  The better we look the more money I get to pay you guys overtime.

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: What was that, Korfin?

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: I said, yeah, you're right, Chief.  As soon as we get somethin' we'll let you alert the media.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: You do that, wiseguy.  Now let's solve this thing before Eddie Flemming does.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Did the D.A. videotape her deposition?

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Yeah.  He finished awhile ago.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Alright.  Swing by her apartment.  Let her pick up her clothes and take her straight to Hoover Street.  You got that?

turns.speaker: KORFIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Coffee for me, I gotta slow down.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Vodka tonic.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Maybe you could just put in a shot of Martell?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: It was freaky, I'll tell you.  Stupid kid.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What's the kid gonna say - sorry? Meanwhile I'm not here anymore. Like last week - we were at the morgue and this guy was all chopped up - spleen here - liver there - his heart in a pan. Six hours ago this guy was walkin' his dog or buyin' a quart of milk.  Who knows?  But some kid's robbed him for $3 or some shit and shot him and now you can't tell if he's a piece of beef or a human being and I'm thinkin' that's me. Sooner or later.  That's me.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm gonna propose.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Tomorrow.  At lunch.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: You ready?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What's he looking for?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: A timer.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Takin' a bath.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Any I.D.?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Still unknown but we're running prints. Kid over there caught the case.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Sorry...PD only.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Only one guys checked in?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: C'mere.  You wanna go to homicide school?  Here - make yourself useful.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: The other side of the street.  The guy with the videocamera.  Don't look - put her in the car.  Stay this side.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Stay with her.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Are you hit?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: No.  I'm okay.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: He got my gun!  Motherfucker was filming the whole time!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I know.  Relax.  Take it easy.  Don't worry, we'll get those fuckers.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Who's there?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Police.  We'd like to ask you a few questions.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I have nothin' to say.  If you wanna contact my attorney...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Homicide, Miss Hearn.  It's Detective Eddie Flemming.  Open up.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: We don't have her I.D. yet, but one of your girls was killed last night at the King Edward Hotel.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh my G-d.  Honey!  Honey's dead?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah.  He wanted a girl from Czechoslovakia, but I sent him Honey 'cause once they get there, you know, it doesn't really matter - Honey was killed...?  Poor girl...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Do you have any Czech girls working for you?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Did you tell him you did?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Boy, she's so popular all the sudden.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Daphne.  Another guy came in asking me about her, too.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: He said he was her cousin.  I told him where she works.  They were just here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Describe him.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Tall, short-haired, scary eyes.  Second guy with him was...shorter, with a wrestler's build.  And he wouldn't turn his videocamera off me.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: He had a videocamera?  Where is she? Quickly!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: She washes hair up at Ludwig's - a salon on 63rd and Madison.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Hey, that's great you guys got it all wrapped up, but you don't mind if we go through the routine?  It gives us somethin' to do.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No, we don't mind.  You mind Leon?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You know what that is, right?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No, what is it?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Why don't you explain it, Bobby.  Hey Camello!  You mind punching a hole in the floor?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: It's your crime scene now.  You can do what you want.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Watch the news?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Nah, I musta missed it.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Well, just so you know.  I gave you guys the credit.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Well, just so you know, I don't care about that stuff.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Nah, why should you?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I don't even watch TV.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Good.  Good.  Commendable.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Did you get a report from the M.E.?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Sure.  But I would like to ask you something.  You got a problem with me?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: If you found me steppin' on your crime scene - it might piss you off, too.  What about the report?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You were right, they were both dead before the fire.  The male was stabbed so hard the killer broke off the tip of the knife in his spine.  That's usually an indicator of something personal.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: The Super said he'd seen her before but she didn't live here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Pretty.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Hmmmm.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Maybe you don't care about that either.  Prettiest suspect I've had in awhile.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Who says she's a suspect?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What would you call her?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Look, I'm not even sure she has anything to do with this.  I saw her outside after the fire - thought it was a lead. Maybe she saw something.  Maybe she was visiting somebody here.  Who knows?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Maybe it's a ritual thing or someone trying to send a message.  Burial rites are taken very seriously in Eastern Europe.  It could be to humiliate them. Just burning them up, no proper funeral, it's like condemning them to hell.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Eastern Europe.  Like what?  Romania? Hungary?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Or Czechoslovakia.  The Slavs have been fighting the Germans and the Russians for a thousand years.  These are very intense people and they take things personally.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'll come with you.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: There wasn't a fire.  There'll be nothing for you to do.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I can watch you, Eddie.  Maybe I'll learn something.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: This isn't homicide school.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: My parents are from Poland.  I can help with the Eastern European angle.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're Polish?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: My folks are.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Stay here.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You goin' to the escort service?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You got any better ideas?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Mind if I ride along with you?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: This has nothing to do with your fire.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: But what if it does?  You might need my help.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'll let you know what happens.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: This is ridiculous.  I'm not gonna be in your way - we can talk the case over.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Tell you what - I'll flip you a coin. If you win you can come with me.  If you don't win, you don't come.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'll call it... tails.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Two heads.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Better than one.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Leon - meet us at 63rd and Madison. Hair salon.  Ludwig's.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'm on my way with Eddie.  Ludwig's. 63rd and Madison.  The suspects might be there already.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You thirsty?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'm on duty.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So am I.  Alright, I'll go inside and you cover the back.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Hey!  I always wanted to be a cop when I was a kid.  I dreamed of running up to a door, kicking it in, pulling my gun and yelling 'Freeze!' at the bad guy! What'd you dream about?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I wanted to run up to a building on fire, kick in the door, rush into the smoke and save a kid.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Then I guess we're doin' this the right way, aren't we?  If we pull up to a burning building I'll gladly let you go first.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What are you hiding?  Why are you afraid

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: She just saw two of her friends killed! They probably threatened her.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Is that all there is?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Something back home?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: She's fucked.  Even if that story is true.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Raw deal.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Look - let me talk to her.  Any leads I get, they're all yours.  Just let me have a first crack at her.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You wanna talk to her alone?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What would your girlfriend think of that?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I don't have a girlfriend.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: My point exactly.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I'm serious here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So am I.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: C'mon.  You intimidate her 'cause you're a celebrity.  She sees me differently.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're her Savior?  Is she the kid you're gonna save from the burning building?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You know what I'm saying here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Okay, tell you what, I'll give you a head start.  You take her to the station house.  Don't let her out of your sight. She's the only warm body we got left.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Hey.  I'm a professional.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Women like that have a way of turning professionals into amateurs.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Look, Eddie, I'm tellin' you - I didn't touch her.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Well, you shoulda because nobody's gonna believe you didn't...including me.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I took her there for a shower and that's it.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Just a shower?

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Yeah, just her in the shower.  Nothing happened.  Look, I'm sure you probably think I'm a fool and I fucked up, but...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No, I don't think you were a fool, I just think you were stupid about it.  I mean, to say the least, you outta know better.  You don't know her well enough. She's got the potential to fucking hang you even if she suggests that you made a pass at her, it's fuckin' over.  You can deny it all you want, but it will not make one fucking bit of difference. You're dead.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: I told you, you know, I thought I was doing the right thing, you know, I think she's innocent.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Well, it's not up to you to decide whether she's innocent or not.  Don't you understand, that's why you're a professional.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: But, I mean, didn't you ever go out on a limb for somebody?  I mean, you shoulda heard her there.  Tellin' her whole story...I believed her.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: How you go out on a limb for somebody is by giving her a number of an Immigration lawyer.  Here, here's a number of an Immigration lawyer.  That's how you help her. But you can't get involved in her like that.  You're gonna jeopardize your career, your life and you're gonna jeopardize my case.  And lemme give you another piece of advice.  Maybe you don't watch TV but I'll let you in on a little secret - the whole fuckin' world watches television.  And when you get out there, they know your face.  And the little fame, the little fuckin' itty bitty fame that I get in this city makes it a lot easier for my job.  And I get more done because of it.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Why'd you help me back there with the Chief?  Why'd you stand up for me like that?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You know, I don't know.  I like you. You remind me of a puppy I used to have. He pissed on the rug all the time, but I still kept him.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: So...who's Nicky?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Your opinion.  You see, they going to make a movie about me, too, Eddie.  And write books.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What's your accomplishment.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: I kill someone famous.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Then do it, asshole.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Good - be tough to the end.  Actor who plays you will want to die like hero.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: So tabloids don't have to do re enactments.  They going to have real movie this time.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: If you kill me and film it you're putting a noose around your neck.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You really think you'll be able to fool a jury with this bullshit?  How fuckin' stupid are you?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Smarter than Americans.  You're fed cry baby talk shows all day long.  Not only will Americans believe me, they'll cry for me.  So...Detective Eddie Flemming, would you like to say goodbye to your Nicolette? Maybe you can propose to her now?

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Detective, does it look like a murder?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: We don't know that yet.  It's much too early.  There's a lot to be done.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: How many victims are up there?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: There are two bodies found at this point.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Can we go up to the crime scene?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You know you can't do that.  C'mon.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Is it drug related?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: We don't know.  When I have more I'll let you know.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Detective - can you tell us what happened here?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I can't talk right now.  We have some things to take care of.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: I understand, but I noticed that the Fire Marshall is here with you.  Is this somehow related to the fire department?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I really can't give out any information right now at this point.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Okay.  But I do understand that your partner, Leon Jackson's been injured. Is that correct?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: He was hurt, but not seriously.  He'll be fine.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Do you have the suspect in custody?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Um...now is not a good time, okay. Detective Jackson's hurt.  He's fine. I've got a Fire Marshall shot, Detective Jackson is hurt but not seriously.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Alright, cut, cut, cut.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Eddie, are you okay?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah.  Now's not a good time.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Alright?

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Hey, honey.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: What is your problem?  Why'd you snap at me?  I just wanted a statement.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I can't...I can't answer you just because you want me to answer you!

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: You didn't have to embarrass me in front of my colleagues.  You could give me something.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Did I embarrass you, sweetheart?  Oh...

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Maybe I should just, ya know...turn to the cameras and say, do you mind if we just work something out?

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Alright, alright, Eddie.  Don't patronize me.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm not.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Yes you are.  I'm not just some reporter.  I don't just stick a microphone in your face.  You could give me something.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah, well you took the camera and put it right down on the evidence.  That was...

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: That was good.  You were holding the evidence.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You were merciless.  You didn't give a shit if you got me or not.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Well, who was it that taught me how to do that?  Huh?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're ruthless.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: You're not so bad yourself.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Look at this.  You have blood on your shirt.  Whose is it?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Could be Leon's.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Jesus.  And last week you came over with blood on your shoes.  What am I going to do with you?

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Don't worry about the damn phone.  I won't answer it.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Answer the phone.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: No.  Tell me what you want to say.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Answer it.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Okay.  Okay.  Hold that thought just for a second.  They only call me when it's an emergency.  Just hold that thought.  Can you call back?

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Oh my G-d, they want me to anchor.  They want me to anchor tonight!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That's good.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Well, that's great.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Okay.  That is great.  But I can't go now, we're in the middle of something here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No.  Go ahead.  You're gonna be great.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: No.  No, listen to me here.  I want to know what you're talking about.  You know, the shoe thing and the marriages and...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'll tell you tonight.  Let's do it tonight.  As soon as you get back we'll talk.  We'll talk.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Promise?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I promise.  We'll talk.  You'll be great.  You'll be fine.  Go ahead, just imagine that, uh... Just look into the lens and imagine you're talking to me.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Yeah.  I'll do that.  As long as you're not patronizing me.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Patronizing you... Nay, I love you.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Okay, til tonight.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Tonight.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: You promise?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah.  I promise.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Okay.  And you know what, I'll swing by my place, grab a couple pairs of shoes and maybe just test them out next to yours...How's that... Would that be a good thing.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.  Good thing.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: See you later.  Good luck.

turns.speaker: NICOLETTE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Don't be late.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So we're waitin' to hit this warrant - we got Emergency Service with the heavy weapons standin' by - ready to go.  I say, lemme get a cigar outta the car.  I go to get the cigar and BOOM!  All the sudden I turn around and a kid with a shotgun let one go.  Right where I was standin'.  That coulda been it.  I coulda had my head blown off and for what?  Some stupid kid got panicky, takes the safety off and it's over.  If I hadn't gone back for that cigar - for a bad habit - I would've had my head blown off.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Jesus Christ.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Sooner or later that's everybody.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Not chopped up.  Not chopped up like that.  I mean, what do I got left? Coupla articles.  A medal or two. Plaque here and there and in a coupla years no one remembers me anymore.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: I think you're getting a little moody there, Eddie.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm not moody.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: How old are your kids?

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: My kids?  Let's see...Susan's 15. Aundrea's 9.  Don't tell me you're thinking about having a kid!  How old are you?  Never mind. Let me just tell you this: Every stupid cliche you hear about kids - they change your life, they make you a better person, they make you whole...  It's all true!  Before I had kids when friends talked about their kids, I wanted to vomit.  Now -- I get it.  Am I right, Leon?

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: So what's unique?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Not what.  Who.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: He's from Antigua.  His girlfriend was taking too long to put her make-up on. they were late for a party.  Stabbed her with a beer bottle.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: That's unique.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah.  And he still went to the party.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I hope this prick doesn't run.  My knees are killing me.  Stay behind me.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: You're worried for my safety.  I'm touched.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Keep them out of my way.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Okay.  You ready?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.  Jesus.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Any chance we can do that again?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Again?  I didn't wanna do it the first time.

turns.speaker: SECONDARY OFFICER
turns.text: Okay.  You work in a vodka factory.  I understand that.  And what kind of work do you do?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: I am butcher.

turns.speaker: SECONDARY OFFICER
turns.text: You're a butcher?  What do you use pig intestines for?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: You stuff sausage in it.

turns.speaker: SECONDARY OFFICER
turns.text: And what do you do with the bones?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Dog food.

turns.speaker: SECONDARY OFFICER
turns.text: Are you married?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: No.  Are you proposing?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Come to 45 Broadway.  Don't bring the Police.  Come alone or you'll be in my next film.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Look asshole.  I've been threatened by better than you.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: No.  I'm the best that's ever threatened you.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: I'll meet you on one condition - I get exclusivity and you surrender to me.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: We'll talk about that.  Four o'clock gives you time to go to bank.  Three hundred thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: What?  It doesn't work that way.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: If you don't want my film - I'll call another show.  And they will show it.

turns.speaker: HAWKINS
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Wait a minute.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Come alone.  Bring cash.  And we'll talk about surrendering.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Were you a fireman?  That how you knew how to rig the apartment?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: My father was.  He gave me many lessons about fire.  Now it's my friend.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Tommy, take a walk.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: You can't kill me.  You're not a cop. Just fireman with a gun.  I bet you never shot anybody in your life.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: You'll be my first.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: C'mon.  Pull the trigger.  Do it.  Oh, look, you're sweating.  You don't have the balls.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Get down on your knees.

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Where's your partner?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: The Sheraton!  On Broadway!  Room 210. Go get Oleg.  He'll kill you.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Tell him to put his gun down!

turns.speaker: JORDY
turns.text: Let her go!  Let her go!!

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: If he doesn't lower his gun I'll fucking kill her.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Hi, I'm Honey.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Where's Czech girl?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Baby, I'm anybody you want me to be. I'm a little schoolgirl, I'm mommy, I'm a Czech girl.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Now I like to get business out of the way before we get down to pleasure.  Why don'tchya put my money on the dresser.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: I ordered a Czech girl.  Daphne, you know her?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: It's an outcall service run out of an apartment.  I don't meet the other girls.  Aren't you gonna get undressed?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Where is escort service?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: That's confidential.  Could you put the money on the dresser?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: I like to talk to the person who runs the service.  Can you give me address?

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Look.  Do we have a problem here? There's no reason to have a problem. I'm gonna make you feel real good.  You wanna Czech girl? After I'm done with you, you won't miss her.  Now why don't you pay me?

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Listen to me.  I don't want sex.  Just give me the address and then you go.

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Look, man, I don't give a shit if you want sex or not, but you're payin' for my time.

turns.speaker: EMIL
turns.text: Give me the address!!

turns.speaker: HONEY
turns.text: Alright, alright - don't hurt me! Please, it's in my book, in my purse!
